message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.AR, cs.SY

Reasoning: 

1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the design of wireless transmission networks and their ability to meet the needs of future scenarios like smart cities. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 

2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the optimization of transport mechanisms to maximize single cell performance. This involves the use of information theory concepts to optimize the transmission of data. 

3. cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) - The paper discusses the design of wireless transmission networks and their ability to meet the needs of future scenarios like smart cities. This falls under the scope of communications and networking. 

4. cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) - The paper mentions the use of silicon-based processing to build a demonstrator as proof-of-concept. This involves the design of hardware architecture for wireless transmission systems. 

5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the management of wireless transmission systems under the premise of strict synchronism and orthogonality. This involves the use of systems and control concepts to manage the transmission of data.
